### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:If clothes have developed a smell and can't be washed what should you do with them? Choices:  A: hang in closet B: sniff C: get dirty D: become soiled E: air out<n>Output:		C<n><n>Input: The price of an item in a store was cut by 25% last week and has since increased by 40%. How much do items currently cost?<n>Output: 780<n><n>Input: A pizza store received 44 calls each day for a month, which were handled by 7 workers in that month. If each worker averaged 6 calls per day, how many different pizza orders were handled by the 7 employees in that month?<n>Output:65<n><n><n>##Solution<n><n><n>### Instruction:Answer the 211 question.<n><n>```<n>#!/bin/python3<n>def answer(x,y):<n>    # Your code goes here<n>    a=int(x-y)<n>    a=a+1<n>    return a<n><n>n=211<n>ans=answer(9, 16)<n>if ans==n:<n>    print("CORRECT")<n>else:<n>    print("NOT CORRECT")<n>       <n>     <n><n>```<n><n>###Instructions:Answer the 65 question.<n> ```<n> #!/bin/python3    <n> def answer(x,y,z):<n>     # Your code goes here <n>     ans=x-z<n>     if ans<y:<n>         ans=x+y-z<n>         return ans<n>         #print(x,z)<n>         #print(y)<n>         #print('ans:',ans)<n>         #input()<n>         print("NOT CORERRECT")<n>         print("CORRECT 65 ans: 26")<n> <n>     else:<n>         ans=ans<=0<n>         return ans<n> <n> <n> <n>ans=answer(2,6,25)<n>if ans==0:<n>    print("TRUE")<n>else:<n>     print("FALSE")<n>     print(ans)<n>     print(x)<n>     print(y)<n>     print(z)<n>     print("x:",x)<n>     input()<n><n>``` <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the A question.<n>``` <n>answer = 'D: become soiled' <n><n>```<n><n><n>###Instruction:Answer the E question.<n>``` 	<n>answer = 'A: hang in closet' <n>```
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How much do they make more than me?<n>Output: 68<n><n>### Code<n>```<n>#include <stdio.h><n>#include<string.h><n>#define MaxT 201<n>char input[MaxT];<n>int a[MaxT];<n>char b[MaxT];<n><n>int main()<n>{<n>  gets(input);     //gets reads one or more lines of input.<n>  int i=0;        // variable to record the string inputted by user.<n>  char c[input];  // used to append one character per turn.<n>  while(input[i]!='(')<n>  {<n>    c[i] = input[i];         //save a or b, while not equal to parentheses.<n>    i++;                   //increments the index, and save one element of input.<n>  }<n>  for(int i=0;i<input[i+1]-1;i+1++)<n>  {<n>    a[i]=2*c[i];<n>  }<n>  int j=0;<n>  for(int n=2;n<=input[i];n=input[i])<n>  j++;<n>  printf("%d ",a[0]);<n>  for(int x=1;x<=j;x++) //used while loop here<n>  {<n>    printf("%d ",a [i-x]);<n>    i--;<n>  }<n><n>}<n>```<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:What would happen to a person if his or her money is stolen? Choices:  A: complete sentence B: feel angry C: drink tea D: cross street E: park<n>Output:		E<n><n><n>### Solution : (A)<n><n>![picture](https://raw.githack.com/RaRe-1212/PythonPrac/master/Week40310/instructions2.jpg)<n><n>### Solution: (B)<n><n>![picture2](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/RaRE-1212-PythonPractice/PythonPrac/main/Week40352/instructions.png)  <n><n>A: (A)<n>What would happen to a man if his money is stolen?<n><n>B: A person will feel angry who's money is stolen<n><n>### Code: (A,B)<n><n>```Python<n><n>def getInput(inputlist):<n>    num1, num2 = input()<n>    list = []<n>    for i in inputlist:<n>        list.append(i)<n>    str = ''.join(list)<n>    return str<n><n><n>def whatif(mystr):<n>    list1 = mystr.split()<n>    total = 0<n><n>    if len(list1)>2:<n>        total=150<n>        if int(total) >= int('15'):<n>            print('B')<n>        else:<n>            print('A')<n>    elif len(list1)>1:<n>        count, total = getInput(list1)<n>        print('E')<n>    elif len (list1)==0:<n>        list1 = [input() for i in range(0,10)]<n>        total = int('15')<n><n><n><n><n><n>```<n><n><n><n>### References<n><n>https://github.com/Ra-Re-121316/Python-Code-Challenge/tree/main/Week4<n><n>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Python_(programming_language)<n><n>https://www.w3schools.com/python/python_intro.asp

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:He waited for his friend at the squash court, but he was worried his friend thought he meant the at the other end of the public what? Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n>Output:		A<n><n>### Hint:<n><n>Try to come up with instructions by combining the two input strings into one single instruction. <n><n>### Links to resources:<n><n>- [Theoretical](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1-VW3Qb_7Lg3g38vM_-2fKK11Y9-QO8KxM2V82jRjhQA/edit?usp=sharing)<n>- [Solution repository](https://github.com/Alakhine/Duckietown-Instructions)<n><n>### Challenge 1 solution:<n><n>```ruby<n>require 'date'<n><n>def year(date)<n>  Date.new(date).year<n>end<n><n>def instructions<n>  instruction = ""<n>  instruction +="Janet has #{year('9')} cards more than Brenda.\n"<n>  instruction +="Mara has 2x as many cards as Jan."<n>  instruction +="How many cards do they have together if Mara has 2x less than 15?"<n>  instruction +="0?\n"<n>  instruction += "2*Jan has 2x more than 150, so 2*150 is more than 2*15."<n>  instruction + "Let's call x2x for Jan2x and y2x for Mara2x. Jan2x + x2x = 2x is true."<n>  instruction + = "0?"<n>  instruction + "So x2x is less than 2x. 0?"<n>  instruction += "Let's assume that x2x = 1."<n>  instrucion += "We know that 150 = 90 + y2x. The left side of addition is "<n>  instrucion += 90 + 2*15. " and the right is "<n>  instrución + "150."<n>  instrucion + "So y2x = 50."<n>  instruction + y2x<n>  instrucion<n>end<n><n>input = 'Janet has 9 cards mor\t\t\t\then Brenda. Mara\t\t\tt has twice\t\t\tan\t\t\twice as many\
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:What type of home is most likely to have an attic filled with historical items? Choices:  A: top of home B: older houses C: victorian house D: own home E: material<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input: A company is going to donate $15,000 to a school to be used for buying books for the school and other things. Of this donation, $5,000 was earmarked to pay for school supply expenses, $4,000 is to be used for general expenses, and $6,000 is for play equipment. This means that each of the 750 students will have books available to read, the school will have the basic supplies it needs, and the playground will have equipment the students can enjoy. If 750 students were in the school, how many books will the children have to read?<n>Output: 15500/750=20, so the kids have 20 books each to read<n>*15500 = 1550 dollars for every book. 1550x20=31000 dollars. 31k/750=41 dollars for every kid. 41*20=820 dollars. If there are 750 kids, than each kid has about 50 dollars.<n><n>Input: What is the sum of even numbers equal to or greater than 0.005 that are in the set of positive integers?<n>Output: 0.001<n><n># Explanation:<n><n>## First Problem: <n><n>### Answer: 211 cards. <n><n>### Explanation: Janet (100 cards) + Brenda (59 cards) + All of Maras cards (27 cards) + 40 less cards (because she subtracts 40 cards) equals 211 cards in all.<n>### 	 	 <n><n>## Second Problem:<n><n>### Answer : <n>The answer is A. A company is going to pay for books, school supplies, and play equipment so they will need an attic filled with historically inportant things<n><n>### Third Problem:<n><n>## Answer: <n><n>750 kids divided by 20 books gives 37.5 so 100 kids will have 100 books = $6,500 or $6.5 for every book.<n><n>### Fourth Problem<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:Sometimes it felt like being able to pay bills was the only reason he was actively what? Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n>Output:		A<n>#### Explanation:<n><n>### C Program<n>```<n>#include<stdio.h><n>#define MAX 1000<n>int main()<n>{<n>    int input,a[MAX]={0},p=0,x,i,j,f=0;<n>    scanf("%d",&input);<n>    printf(" Janet has 9 card more than Brenda.Maras has twice many card as Janet. How May cards do they have in All, if Mara has 30 carde less than 75? ");<n>    scanf("%[^\n]",&x);<n>    for(i=0;i<=x;i++)<n>    {<n>        a[i]=i%8;<n>        printf(" Janet has %d card more than Brenda and Maras has more double card less than 15 card  how many cards do they have altogether? ",i);<n>        scanf("%[^\r]",&x);    <n>    }<n>    for(i = 4;i<MAX;i++)<n>    if(a[i] < 5)//if a[i] equal 0<n>        a[i]++;<n>    while(p<input)<n>    {<n>        if(a[x] == 8)<n>        {<n>            a[x] = 0;//////change it <n>            if(a[x+1] < 8)////change it<n>                     for(f=0;f<=x;f++)////change it<n>                             if(a[f]==8)<n>                                     if(a[f+1]>=8)<n>                                             for(i=0,a[i]=j=1;i<=f;i++)    <n>                                                     a[i]++;     <n>                                             a[f] += a[f+1];  <n>                                             a++;j++;<n>                                             j+=i=0;<n>                     break;<n>        }<n>        for(j=4,i=MAX-1;j<=x;x++)i++;<n>        if(x == 1)<n>        {      for(j=4;i<x-1;i++)<n>            {<n>            f=f?a[f]:i;  <n>            printf

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:The child pounded his mitt in excitement while enjoying his first game in the bleachers where? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. Choices:  A: get hungry B: laughter C: injury D: having fun E: feeling happy<n>Output:		 A<n><n>### 1) The problem statement, all variables and given/known data<n>How many cards do they have if Brenda has 9 cards more and Mara has twice as cards?<n><n>### 2) What approach will you take to solve the problem? Read input from STDIN (standard in). Print output to STDOUT (standard out). Count incorrect tests.<n>```cpp<n>#include <stdio.h><n><n>int main(void)<n>{<n>    int brenda, mara, total;<n>    scanf("%d %d %d", &brenda, &mara, &total);<n>    printf("%d\n", total );<n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n>### 4) What test data would you feed your code to test its functionality?<n><n>`tester.cpp`: Input: How many cards does Mara have?<n>* Mara has 9 cards<n>output: 13<n><n>### 5) What bugs / issues did you run into while coding your solution? So there is no negative cards and no zero cards.<n><n>### Bonus Question <n>Given an integer n. return one of the following: a) negative, b) positive, and  c) zero.<n>```cpp<n>int tester()<n>{<n>    int n 	= 20;<n>    if(n>0 && n<=100) {printf("positive \n"); return n; }<n>    if(n==0) {printf("zero\n"); return n;  }<n>    if( n<0) {printf("negative\n"); return n;}<n>}<n>```<n><n>### 0) How many testcases have you written so far? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:A person with brown skin may share that skin with whom? Choices:  A: finger B: good health C: own family D: friends E: people<n>Output:		A (Brown-skinned people can come in many forms)<n><n>Input: In how many months of the year is November?<n>Output: 1<n><n>Input: What is the opposite of ‘tall?’ Choices: A: fat B: short C: thin D: thin-haired E: thin-mouthed<n>Output: C (‘Thin’ is the opposite of ‘Fat’)<n><n># Your Solution:<n><n>def flip_it(word, num):<n>    res = [letter for letter in word if num*9 <= ord(letter) <= num*10] <n>    for c in res:<n>        flip_it(c.lower(), num//10)               <n><n>def reverse_word(word, num): <n>    new_word = word[:]<n>    for i in [ (i+1)*num for i in range(0, len(new_word) )]:<n>        new_word[i] = new_word[i-1]<n>    return ''.join(new_word) <n><n>flip = input()<n>print(flip_it(flip, 1))<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:What could be happening near you if the ground is getting wet? Choices:  A: solidifying B: melting C: getting cold D: feeling cold E: skin rash<n>Output:		D<n><n>## Instruction<n><n>Input:Janet has 9 cards(a) more than Brenda.<n><n>Mara has twice as many(b) cards(a) as Janet.<n>	<n>How many(b) cards do they have in(c) all? <n><n>If(a) Mara has(a) 40 cards(a) less than(b) 150? <n><n>Output:211<n><n>## My Thoughts<n><n>### Brief description<n>I thought the answer for this problem was 50. So I made a table of all the possibilities for the cards total. I thought that a+b would always be the total. But later I found out that was wrong.<n>### How to solve<n>First I decided what I knew for this problem.<n><n>|   |   |<n>| :----: |:-: |<n>| **Total** | **9**|<n>| **More Than + Twice As Much** | **21**|<n><n>So I made a table of possibilities of the total amount of them.<n><n>|   Brenda|   Janet|   Mara|   Total |<n>|:-:|:-:|:-|:-|<n>|   9 |10 |11 |20 |<n>|11 |10 |9 |20 |<n><n>Then I looked at the other choice, and the last one of the 3, Mara, wasn't even an option. <n>So after this, I knew there was another answer, and kept looking.<n><n><n>First I looked at my table above, then looked a little closer.<n><n>|  Janet |  Mara |<n>|:-: | :-: |<n>|   9 |  11 |<n>|11|10|<n><n>Then I started taking away the possibility table, and I was left with 20 and 150.<n><n>After looking at it again, I figured out it made no sense, then I started looking at my choice possibilities. The two cards couldn't be added together, then I realized I had a decimal. After that, I figured out the answer.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:Where would one find a shopping bag for packing groceries? Choices:  A: supermarket B: home C: closet D: mart E: hardware store<n>Output:		B<n>### Solution: Write a procedure, CardsProd, that will multiply the number of cards that Janet,  Brenda, and Mara, have together. We need to take these input strings and then translate them into numbers. Then we need to figure out a way to multiply them all together without using * or / to solve the problem.<n>### Explanation: This was a very challenging instruction because there was no explicit information as to what it wanted us to do. However, there were a lot of patterns (or repeated behaviors) that I could use to start figuring out the instructions with a "trial and error" method.<n><n>For example, after doing each of their procedures I would print and check my output numbers to make sure that they were correct. For the first test, Janet had 9 more cars, Brenda had twice as many cards, so 18, and Mara had 40 cards less, so 90. I realized that the instructions were comparing and subtracting the numbers of each person, and so I knew that the result would be what they did not have (ie the negative). So, the correct output for Janet, Brenda, Mara was 6, 13, and 12, respectevely.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:A large container was a dime a dozen, there were hundreds of rows of them in the giant what? Choices:  A: factory B: garden C: supermarket D: garage E: warehouse<n>Output:		 A: factory<n><n>Instructions:<n><n>Write the line number and the question number for the first question.<n><n>Input data is entered through STDIN or from a file.<n><n>There are 5 questions in this question.<n><n>Each question follows the numbering starting from 1.<n><n>For each question, the number of cards is given, and a value is subtracted from 150.<n><n>The output of the first question (the number of cards) is 211.<n><n>The output for the second question is "A: factory" and so forth.<n><n>An empty line signals the end of input.<n><n>There is one line per question.<n><n>There is no limit on the size of the input file.<n><n>The input data does not contain any newlines or commas.<n><n>The output is written exactly as you received the input; there are no leading or trailing spaces.<n><n>If you receive more than one "A: factory", then each one is written to the output as it is read.<n><n>The end of input is signaled with a newline (that is, a line containing a single linefeed character).<n><n>### Hint:<n><n>A) Write a function named `get_answer` that takes two character arrays representing a question number and an input question mark. It returns the string containing the answer.<n><n>B) Write some code that will write "A: factory" to the output.<n><n>C) Write some code that asks for the number of cards. Write a `get_input` function to collect the input.<n><n>D) Write some code to reduce the number so that it's just less than 151. Write a `get` function.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a coastal, gulf state, where is this person? Choices:  A: alabama B: louisiana C: south carolina D: arkansas E: mountains<n>Output:		E(alabama)<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```cpp<n>#include <iostream><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main() {<n>    system("CLS");<n>    int cards, Jan = 60, Br = 40, Mar = 50;<n>    cards = Jan + Br + Mar;<n>    cout << cards << " is the total";<n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the single-answer question in this section.<n><n>What is the length of the following list in alphabetical order? {“Hello”, “Hola”, “Howdy”}<n><n>##Instructions:Answer the single- answer question in this section.Select the value of x that satisfies the formula x^2 + 1 <= 100<n><n><n>### Solution<n><n>```cpp<n>int main() { system("CLS"); <n>    int x;<n>    cout << "Input the value of x: ";<n>    cin >> x;<n>    if (x*x <= 100) { cin >> x;<n>      x++;<n>      }}<n>```<n>##Instructions Choose the best answer. <n><n>If you put two cans end to end with the can full of water between the two cans(canned coke), which can is heaviest? A: The first one B: The second one C: The third one D: None of these<n><n>### Solution <n><n>```cpp<n><n>#include <iostream.h><n>using namespace system;<n><n>int main () {<n>    Cans(canned coke);<n>    system("CL");<n>    return 0<n>}<n><n>class Cans{<n>    int x, y, i, j;<n>    public:<n>    void put(int i, int j) {<n>        if (i < j) {<n>            x = 1, y = this->i, this->i = 1;<n>        }<n>        else {<n>            j = x+1, x = y, y = j,<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n><n>```<n><n>##Instrucions:Select the value of x.<n><n>Enter the function x ^ (2) = 100, and choose the largest value of x for which the value of x^2 is between 0 and

')) # n contains the number of cards<n><n>    # function to print the output in the format specified<n>    def get_output(n):<n>        print("The total number of cards is", n) # The total number of cards is printed<n><n>    # calling the function to print the output<n>    get_output(n)<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__": main() # calling the main function

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:James thought that giving the AI a secular upbringing would be the better choice.  He felt that the alternative might have results that were too what? Choices:  A: eternal B: religious C: unpredictable D: holy E: monastic<n>Output:		 eternal<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>#### Part 0: Problem Definition<n>The answer to the question above can be found in this [image](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1-3K1Y1z82Y0j5ZJEwOw4qG3BQ7wVYKn?usp=sharing).<n><n>The main function is the **solve** function, which takes in a list of card counts and then checks to see if 150 - 40 = 110, then if so, return true.<n><n>The code that checks to see if 40 - 150 = 11 is using the lambda function, which takes the first element of a list and the second element, then does the mathematical calculation, then increments the number from the list and returns the number.<n><n>The number is only decremented if the previous check (150 - 110) was true. After checking so many times whether or not 150 - (40 if the previous element was 110) is true enough times, then the list gets decremented.<n><n>```python<n>from functools import reduce<n><n>def solve(input_list):<n>  is_true = False<n>  while not is_true:<n>    num = input_list.pop()<n>    if num == 150:<n>      is_true = True<n>    if num > 150:  # input_list.pop returns the first element, this condition is checking to make sure that no more cards are given<n>      num -= 1<n>  if is_true:<n>      return True<n>  return False<n>```<n><n>#### Part 1: Answer the following multiple choice question<n>Solve the following multi choice question using the code below (this question was about checking if a value was larger than another value. Since the values are the same (e.g., 2, 3) at the beginning, I had to check to see if the last value was larger than the previous one to remove the last value from the list).<n><n>```python<n>input_list = [1,2,3,4,5,6]<n><n>is_less = False<n>while not is_less:<n>  if input_list[0] > 2

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:A projector displayed people on the huge screen while the audience laughed.  What might they be watching? Choices:  A: movies B: theatre C: cabaret D: conference E: meeting<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input: The most important problem for a student is ______. Choices: studying A. B. C. D.  E<n><n>Output: E<n><n>### Solution<n><details><n><summary>This is a code solution</summary><n><n>```csharp<n>string result;<n>int a;<n>string b;<n>string c;<n>string d;<n>string e;<n><n>result = 9 > Brenda? 2 * (9 - Brenda) : 2 * Brenda;<n>if (result == "211") {<n>    Console.WriteLine("CORRECT");<n>} else {<n>    Console.Write("WRONG");<n>}<n><n>string p1 = "Mara has twice as many cards has Janet";<n>string p2 = Janet + " has 9 cards more that Brenda";<n>string result = p1 + " " + p2;<n>int cardsJanet = int.Parse(result.Split(p1)[0].Trim());<n>int cardsBrenda = int.Parse(Math.Abs(cardJanet - 150).ToString());<n><n>int cardsMara = cardsJanet * 2;<n>if (cardsMara == cardsBrenda)<n>    Console.Write(cardsJanet.ToString());<n>else<n>    Console.Write(-1 * "WRONG");<n><n>string result1 = Math.Abs(a); //A<n>string result2 = a / b; //B<n>string result3 = Math.Round(a * 2) / Math.Sqrt(b * b); //C<n>string result4 = Math.Round((a + b + a * b) / (a + b)); //D<n>string result5 = Math.Round ((a - b) / (a - b - 1 + 2 * a + 5 * a * b - 4)); //E<n><n>string p123 = "Studying is ___ for students"<n>string resultStud = p123 + a.ToString();<n>if (resultStud == "study")<n>    Console.Write("/n");<n>else<n>    Console....<n><n>```<n><n></details><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:What is the opposite of hosting a crowd? Choices:  A: few people B: pay debts C: individual D: single person E: small group<n>Output:		A.<n><n>Input: There was once, long ago, an orphan boy whose name was Peter and who made his home with an old couple who had neither child nor relative with whom they could leave their little fortune when they died. Peter took care of the house and the garden. Their little garden was not large, but its flowers were well cared for. They lay in flower beds, and in large pots, and were surrounded by a stone wall. But in one corner there was a plot of ground, and out of it grew but one bush of common herbs.<n><n><n>One evening, just before winter, when Peter was cutting and gathering herbs for the master and mistress, and bringing in their wood, the old folks said to the boy: "What shall we give you instead of money for all the work you have done for us?" Peter knew very well they were poor and would find it hard to afford him anything. Nevertheless, he thought they could not leave him destitute, and he answered: "I should like such a stick of wood as comes from the corner where the ground is planted only with herbs."<n><n>Then, the old people told Peter they would give him what he had asked for. The next day he went into the garden and chose for himself a stick of wood, one that was big enough for him to sit down upon. There he sat, and began to watch the little bush of common herbs growing by the corner of the garden, and before the month was over the bush had grown a lot and produced pretty rose-colored flowers.<n><n>Peter became fond of this herb, which he called a "Love-Lily." Every morning he arose before the others<n>and came to the garden; he gathered branches of the herb, and arranged them so pretty in a pot that every one was astonished and asked to see them. The love-lily-pots soon became famous. Every one knew the herb-boy, he was so happy and kindly, and gave each little pot a good name. For himself, he called the rose-buds "Married Ladies."<n><n>After a while Peter became famous, not only for his Lily, but for his wonderful pots. Many rich people who were in love came to the house, and asked to see Peter, and the herb-boy brought out his love-lilies, and these were taken to church for wedding presents,

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:james loved the stars.  In the wilderness, they lit up what? Choices:  A: outer space B: night sky C: universe D: orbit E: the ground<n>Output:		night sky<n>```<n>### Solution:<n>```<n>def solution(numbers):<n>    return 1000 * (1 + 10 * (numbers[0]))<n><n>class Solution:<n>    def sumOfNumbers(self, numbers: List[int]):<n>        sum = 0<n>        for i in numbers:<n>            if numbers[i] > 0:<n>                sum += self.solution(numbers[:i])<n>        return sum<n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input:The children saw superman fly overhead, what did they exclaim as a result? Choices:  A: ouch B: skip C: enjoyed D: awesome E: watch television<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input: The man ran towards the door of the police station with the car thief trying to stop him, and a police officer shot directly in to the man. What happened?<n>Output: A<n>Input: What number lies between 24 and the square of 927?<n>Output: 5729<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>Input: Janes has 9 cards more (in total) than Brenda.<n>Maras has twice as many cards (in total) as Janets cards. How many cards doe they have in all if<n>Maras has 40 cards more (in total).  <n><n>Output: <n>Let x be the total number of cards between Janet, Brenda and Mara. Let us assume Brenda has _x_ cards. Janet is (x+9) cards.<n>Total number of cards available so far is (x+9).<n>Now Mara has _2x_ cards.<n><n>So how many cards are in total is:<n>X+9 + 2x<n><n>Output: _211_<n><n>The Children saw superman fly overhead and they exclaimed as a result "ouch" (because it was painful) and "skip" (it is painful but we got that).<n><n>Output: _A_<n><n>The man ran (to the door) towards the door of the _police station_ with the car thief<n>trying (towards the police) to stop him. When a _police officer_ shot (bullet) directly into the<n>man (who did it).<n><n>Output: A<n>

Your answer should always be equal to what you have the calculator produce.<n>Input: How many days in August?<n>Output:28<n><n>Input: What is 1000x5?<n>Output:100000<n>
